standard_metadata.standard_description: Understand p + q as the number located a distance |q| from p, in the positive or negative direction depending on whether q is positive or negative. Show that a number and its opposite have a sum of 0 (are additive inverses). Interpret sums of rational numbers by describing real-world contexts.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Adding negative numbers on the number line

question.content: **Which number line model represents the expression $-2+\left(-\dfrac{7}{2}\right)$?**

images.alt: A number line with 16 evenly spaced ticks from negative 9 to 6 in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 to negative 2 points 2 units to the left. Another arrow above it from negative 2 to negative 5.5 points 3.5 units to the left. Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective points on the number line.

A number line with 16 evenly spaced ticks from negative 9 to 6 in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 to negative 2 points 2 units to the left. Another arrow above it from negative 2 to 1.5 points 3.5 units to the right. Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective points on the number line.

A number line with 16 evenly spaced ticks from negative 9 to 6 in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 to 2 points 2 units to the right. Another arrow above it from 2 to negative 1.5 points 3.5 units to the left. Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective points on the number line.

question.content: **Which number line model represents the expression $\dfrac{5}{2} + 3$?**

images.alt: A vertical number line from 6 to negative 6 with evenly spaced tick marks. An arrow from 0 to 2.5 points 2.5 tick marks is on right of the number line goes upwards. Another arrow on right of this arrow from 2.5 to 5.5 points 3 tick marks goes upwards. Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective points on the number line. The number line reads from bottom to top: negative 6, negative 4, negative 2, 0, 2, 4 and 6.

A vertical number line from 6 to negative 6 with evenly spaced tick marks. An arrow from 0 to negative 2.5 points 2.5 tick marks is on right of the number line and goes downwards. Another arrow on right of this arrow from negative 2.5 to negative 5.5 points 3 tick marks goes downwards. Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective points on the number line. The number line reads from bottom to top: negative 6, negative 4, negative 2, 0, 2, 4 and 6.

A vertical number line from 6 to negative 6 with evenly spaced tick marks. An arrow from 0 to negative 2.5 points 2.5 tick marks is on right of the number line and goes downwards. Another arrow on right of this arrow from negative 2.5 to 0.5 points 3 tick marks goes upwards. Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective points on the number line. The number line reads from bottom to top: negative 6, negative 4, negative 2, 0, 2, 4 and 6.

Negative 1 labeled above negative 4 fourths, 0 labeled above 0 fourth and 1 labeled above 4 fourths on the number line. An arrow from 0 fourth to negative 2 fourths points 2 units to the left. Another arrow above it, from negative 2 fourths to 3 fourths points 5 units to the right. Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective point on the number line.

Dotted lines connect the end of the arrowheads to the respective points on the number line. The number line reads from bottom to top: negative 9, negative 6, negative 3, 0, and 3.
